name: Stratosphere Hotel, Casino and Tower

reviews.text: Got a killer package deal on Travelocity, so we thought we'd give it a try. Was very, very pleased with the experience at the Stratosphere. Got one of the recently renovated rooms on an upper floor, and it was awesome - it actually looked just like the pictures posted on their site. Room was clean, functional, nicely decorated, and aired out. The bed was fantastic - big cushy new mattress with high quality bedding and lots of pillows. And maybe I just got lucky, but the hotel seemed quiet for all four nights I was there - no amatuer young drinkers stumbling and "woo-ing" up and down the halls, and no objectionable noise to speak of from the street. Elevators were fast and kept spotless.
reviews.title: Nearly Flawless for the Price - Will Be Back

reviews.text: The casino was a lot of fun, and seemed to have a wide variety of patrons (everything from Jersey Shore candidates to Midwestern types). I wouldn't say the slots were loose per se, but the money seemed to last a bit longer here than on other places on the Strip. Drink service was good - the drinks were weak as water, but they kept them coming quickly and were very friendly. Actually, all the staff I encountered, from the cleaning crew to the conscierge, were very friendly and efficient. And while I think the $8 per night or whatever they charge for a "resort fee" is lame, it does include unlimited passes to the tower observation deck, which provides a surreal view, night or day.
reviews.title: Good hotel but nowhere near the main 'strip'

reviews.text: As for the location... yes, it is kind of isolated. But if you plan well and are prepared to shell out a bit for the bus, monorail, or taxi, you'll be fine. It's probably too far to walk to the "good" stuff on the Strip, and I wouldn't advise walking to downtown under any circumstances, unless you're with a large posse of sober ninjas that could take on all the toothless and tweaking street people swarming that particular stretch. The Strat is somewhat of a self-contained city, anyway (with tons of onsite shops and conveniences), and you can probably take care of the majority of your wants and needs within the confines of the property. Roxy's Diner had great food, and the little Mexican place upstairs was pretty good, too. There's also a McDonald's and Starbucks onsite if you just need something fast.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Service Caught Me By Suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can honestly only find one fault with the Stratosphere, and that's the bar soap they provide. The lotion, shampoo, shower gel and conditioner are fine, but that bar soap was useless and vile. Seriously - that's my only gripe about the place.
reviews.title: It is okay if you have a deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Will absoutely be back to stay and play here. I hope everyone else has the same good experience.
reviews.title: Nice property in a bad part of Vegas

reviews.text: wonderful views from the very top of vegas,free if you stay,just show your room card, not to be missed. busy casino, cleaned frequently. Very helpful staff, in the casino and in restaurants. Our room was cleaned regularly. We were on the 18th floor and the views were captivating, always something to see, eg airplanes landing and taking off in the distance. Location in our opinion,is great, in between downtown and the Strip. If you don't want the expense of taxi fare seeing all vegas, use the deuce bus (24hr) up and down the strip and downtown, 8$ for 24 hr travel, and it stops right outside the "stratosphere" couldn't really be much easier. We have stayed at the "strato" many times now, and have noticed the improvement in rooms and service, since we started visiting 6 years ago. The price is right, and we always enjoy our visits, lovely to get the hustle and bustle of the strip,and then great to get back to our room for some quiet and relaxation. Wouldn't stay anywhere else now. Beds and sheets supercomfy and appreciated at the end of some exhausting but just fabulous days in and around vegas. Thanks "strato" for a great holiday once again.
reviews.title: best ever stay

reviews.text: although up at top end of the strip and a bit seperate from other hotels ,was a good hotel to stay at ,cheaper than most other of the main hotels ,was still worth staying rooms were a good standard beds comfortable clean and tidy could not ask for more ,would recommend eating at Roxys diner good food good entertainment , overall a good experience thanks
reviews.title: stratosphere stay
Nice located place!
reviews.text: I stayed a couple of days and had a lot of fun in and outside of this hotel. Service was good, cleaning was very good. It's not too expensive and is well located so you can enjoy a walk around or drive to other places in Vegas. If i go to Vegas again i'll consider to stay there again.

I was on an extended business trip and I stayed at the Stratosphere only because I had a deep discount on the room. I have stayed at the Stratosphere on several other occasions and all stays were similar.
reviews.title: Hotel review - not a review of the Tower attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the Stratosphere is NOT part of the famous Las Vegas Strip. It is more like being in a DMZ between the Strip and Downtown Las Vegas. It is in the middle of "no-man's land" because there are no other big name hotels or other attractions within walking distance. (The new SLS Hotel & Casino just a block south will not be open until Oct 2014). The surrounding are is akin to Compton and you literally are in the middle of Vegas' unpublicized gang war zone. complete with crack houses and drug dealers.
reviews.title: McCalls Heartland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were able to get a great deal for a direct flight and 3 nights at the Stratosphere through Travelocity. We opted to pay $7 extra per night for a newly remodeled select room. We requested a room with a King bed but when we checked in we were told our room had 2 Queens. The hotel clerk told us we could switch to a King room the next day. Since we were there for only a few nights, we decided to stay in the room with the 2 beds.
reviews.title: Great vacation package

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and the bathroom was large. The bed was comfortable. I believe the air must be on a motion sensor since it was hot when we returned to the room and hot during the night.
reviews.title: vegas cheapy
Stay for 2!
reviews.text: stayed here September 2013, and found hotel staff very helpful on arrival. hotel is well used and very affordable, though a bit worn round the edges. the room we had was let down as the view was of the roof area and various air con outlets etc. but as it was only some place to crash it suited us fine, star bucks in house very expensive but local eateries good value and a mc Donald's on first floor very good. only down fall was how far from the strip you are but busses just round the corner, cabs aplenty by main entrance and mono rail ten minutes walk by what was the Sahara, bar area great with music and view from the tower out standing

My husband and I had our first trip to Vegas and stayed at the stratosphere. We enjoyed our stay after we FINALLY got into our room. We had to make 3 trips back to the front desk for them to finally get our key working, but once we were in, there were no problems. We loved the pool and enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great value and comfortable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of visiting Las Vegas for the first time ever this summer and it turned out to be a blast! We stayed at the Stratosphere Hotel for 2 days and had a great time. The rooms were decent. The price was affordable. The view from the tower was spectacular and I'm glad I was able to experience it. The only thing I did not like was that it was situated a little too far from the center of the strip. I think this hotel is perfect for first timers visiting Las Vegas.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay
My favorite place!!!
reviews.text: We traveled to Las Vegas for our Honeymoon 11-17-07. Being there once before as a child I had not seen the Stratosphere( it wasn't there back then). We feel we made the right choice staying here. We loved everything about it especially Roxy's Diner & all the rides. We 5 days 4 nights and I didnt want to leave. This is a wonderful place to stay and I would stay here again!!!!

I have stayed at the Stratosphere 3 times in the past 4 years and obviously I like it or shall I say WE. My husband, sister and brother in law always wanna stay there. Ok, so the ONLY downside is the fact that it is at the end of the strip but... take a cab, the DEUCE, the monorail or just walk! The price and quality of hotel is worth it. We have stayed in the World Tower and the Premier Tower, the PREMIER Tower is the nicer of the 2 but they are both great. The pool is nice as well. Everything is in this hotel you could ask for, it is very clean, and everyone is friendly. GREAT breakfast buffet also! Ate there 2 days in a row! Worth the money for sure!!! We all loved it! Go to the observation tower for a great view if you are not afraid of heights. I recommend this hotel to anyone, my 5 year old son loves it, he says it is his favorite!
reviews.title: I love the STRATOSPHERE!

reviews.text: If your thinking of using this hotel or expedia please read before you book it!
reviews.title: Worst Hotel in Vagas

reviews.text: Traveled in a party of 7, should have been 8 to this hotel. On arrival discovered that room was in the name of someone who lost their passport and could not travel from the UK with us. Hotels response was instead of the 4 rooms we had paid for and were expecting we were told we could not have one of the rooms as the room was in the name of the person who dropped out! This was after an hour and a half in a queue trying to check in! Ended up sleeping on the floor of another persons room! Next day insisted on speaking to the manager who eventually gave us another room after an hour of calling expedia who were as useful as an ashtray on a motor bike. Their response for requests to sort it out was to tell us there was nothing they could do. Will be taking legal action on this one. The hotel is tired and expensive with not much to do. Service was slow and i didn't get a free drink until the third day! Location is bad as it is half way between the nice hotels, Luxor etc. and downtown, which was one and a half miles away. Don't walk it though as the area is very dodgy with plenty of massage parlors and tags sprayed on walls.
reviews.title: OK Room

reviews.text: Note while we were there Vagas had five separate school shooting incidents according to local news reports. Not a place for families. Don't wander the streets at night and don't walk down any side streets. Stay on the main street if you want to be safe. Treat yourself and stay in New York if you can. Watch out for the hookers who pounce on you if you are wandering round the hotel when you can't sleep There pimps usually sit in the elevator lobby's. Recommend you definitely give this hotel a miss and only use expedia if you don't want any customer service if you have any issues!
reviews.title: room without a view.. long long check in... old..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really don't know what to say about this hotel...there were as many good points as there were bad.
reviews.title: hmmmm

likes.liked: — The pool area and the food in the Top Of The World restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll start with the good - the pool area was great and had ample space for guests (well in october anyway, don't know about peak season) and a nice pool bar which wasn't too expensive. The water in the pool was a bit too col to get in but the hot tub was reat and the music played around the pool area was varied and bearable.
reviews.title: Getting Worse......

likes.liked: — no comment because things are going downhill for this casino

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakast buffet was quite good - the omellette station i found was completely addictive and generally good - however, some things would have been a bit better if they were cooked to order rather than left to congeal or go stale.
reviews.title: Good moderate price Hotel / Casino

likes.liked: — Value for money, location north of the strip (for our event we visited)
likes.disliked: — everything was satisfactory - for wow factor, pay more and stay further down the strip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Top of The World restaurant was exquisite (sp?) and i cannot fault the 3 courses we had one bit - I can however, say that we felt really rushed out by the waiting staff who brought out our main course and dessert immediately after the course before. Because we had only just finished chewing our amazing fillet of beef, we had to leave our dessert - we needed maybe 15 minutes rest time instead of 1. Then when we had 'finished' our dessert our waiter said he wouldn't 'tell' of we sneaked out with our rinks to the upstairs observation level - just felt really rushed out of the place which is a shame when paid $200 for the pleasure of being there for just over an hour.
reviews.title: Las Vegas for first-timers

reviews.text: Now, the not so good - our room had a bad smell to it the whole time we were there which we pin-pointed to the sink. Our sheets may/may not have been changed during our stay. The casino itself smelled musty and was really, really smokey at times. Dinner at the twice zagat rated Fellinis Italian restaurant would have been better if my carbonnara hadn't have had dried 'baco-bits' in rather than ham or real bacon - come on, how hard is it guys?
reviews.title: Not so great...
We will never forget this vacation!
reviews.text: My mom and I went to Las Vegas September 17th-20th. Our flight was actually delayed, so by the time we got to the Stratosphere Hotel it was actually early in the morning of the 18th. Vegas is the city that never sleeps so that was no big deal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now we are not picky people at all, but we had problems the moment we arrived at the hotel.
reviews.title: It's worth the extra $ to be on the Strip instead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First we had to find parking, which was pretty full at that time being that we arrived so late. Then we had to find our way to the lobby to check in. I'm not sure if I'm the only one, but I found the hotel layout to be quite confusing.
reviews.title: They did it again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our major dilemma of the trip occurred next. The hotel checkin staff informed us that they were very busy and that we were being upgraded for one night only because they didn't have any standard rooms available. So we were quite excited thinking that this was our lucky day, and then we went to our room. We opened the door and here this male voice "get out of here" and this lady comes out of the bedroom in a bathrobe!!! So back down we go to the lobby and get reassigned to a new room. This time it's a standard room so I'm not sure what all the song and dance was about not having any available. The hotel did give us free breakfast at the buffet restaurant (approx. $24 value) for our inconvenience. The buffet was good, I would eat there again if I go back.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

likes.liked: — Location was nice, the rides at the Stratosphere, modern-ish feel downstairs, casino

reviews.title: Some Good Points
reviews.text: So we finally got checked in and settled into our room and we were starving, so we decided to get something to eat. We went to the IHOP just down the street and discovered exactly what kind of neighbourhood we were in. Not exactly the nicest part of town!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights during our trip to the west coast. It was the cheapest of all the hotels in which we stayed but the room was as good as any.It was a large room with a very large bed and was very clean. We didn't have much of a view but we hardly spent anytime in the room anyway. The hotel itself is a bit dated and could do with a refurb, it's a bit 70's.But it had adequate facilities an we ate a buffet breakfast there once which was quite good.The highlight of the hotel is the tower and the wonderful tower restaurant. We opted for the lunch menu and it was well worth the visit.The views of Las Vegas from the rotating restaurant are spectacular and probably the best view of Las Vegas from anywhere,so even if you opt not to stay here I would recommend lunch in the restaurant.
reviews.title: good value for money
Nice hotel but distant from the strip
reviews.text: The hotel is not situated centrally for the strip and some people have commented the they didn't like the area around.Granted it is not the best of places on the strip, but we didn't feel threatened at any time. On the whole I would say that the hotel was fine and good value for money.

Stratosphere hotel has a nice outdoor pool and fitness area with machines and free weights. The rooms are large and clean with good views. You get free visits up the tower, which is not to be missed. There is everything from snack areas to fancy places to eat. The rooms have hair dryers and irons. The only down side it the distance from everything. Be aware of the huge rate changes on the weekend. I arrived on Monday and we left for the weekend for Zion national park in Utah.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Vegas was better to visit during the week before it got very busy on the weekend. We did come back into Vegas the second weekend and there seems to be no down time, huge crowds.
reviews.title: Tiny Bathroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a good place to save money if you don't mind taking the bus, or driving. Be aware that a taxi ride may cost more than you think because a driver may take the long slow way to run the bill up. As a bus driver told us, a $10 ride in a taxi could end up being $40 if you get a dishonest driver. We experienced this the second week, so it does happen.
reviews.title: Stratosphere Stay

likes.liked: — Free tickets to top of tower.
likes.disliked: — Pool was not heated, prices to high for soda an snacks, no flat screen tv.

reviews.title: Good price, good stay, no problems
reviews.text: I'm a Stratosphere veteran ... I've stayed there each year for the past 7 years for March Madness. I haven't had a bad experience yet.

reviews.title: First time in Vegas, great place to stay!
reviews.text: When it comes to rooms, I'd rather spend my money at the tables, so I'm not too picky ... especially when the price is right. In the past we had a nice view of the Strip and what seemed to be a modern room (in the Premier Tower), but this year we were put in a room facing downtown and the room didn't seem to be as nice. Tried to get another room, but the hotel was pretty booked. Oh well, it served it's purpose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a super high-class Vegas hotel, you'll be in for a surprise. This hotel is value based and is for an average clientele. It's off the beaten path a bit (and the neighborhood is a bit iffy), but otherwise I have no real complaints. Go in with an open mind and you won't be disappointed. I also heard that the property was recently purchased ... don't know if it will make a difference.
reviews.title: Full of criminals

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Check in was smooth, Starbucks in lobby, good restaurant choices (sometimes a bit slow when busy), cheap table minimums, Valet parking, pool area and weight room is nice (but they sock you with a $5 resort fee), beds were fairly comfy
reviews.title: Quite Nice

reviews.text: Cons: Super slow service at the bar located by the Sports Book, no free Wi-Fi, rooms could use a refresher, housekeeping not that good.
reviews.title: Better than I expected!

likes.liked: — Clean and a great value for what we paid
likes.disliked: — Too far from the main strip

reviews.text: Pros - cheap, friendly staff, nice pool, some good shows
reviews.title: Good enough

reviews.text: Cons-small bathroom,loud a/c machines,far from the strip, bums
reviews.title: Average Stratosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is average, the rooms are good for 2-3 ppl, we had a few problems (clogged sink). The maid service was good (unclogged sink fast). If you are with ppl that you cant change infront of expect to fall over the toilet in the bathroom. The hotel is far from the strip which cause alot of spending on taxis,monorail and sore feet. For some reason there are some homeless ppl in that area. Anyways, honestly spend the extra $$ and stay in a hotel on the strip. Vegas is ment to be big and flashy and an experience. If you really are short on cash then I guess this is ok for you. Although we spent alot on taxis. So I dunno. Also dont bother eating at that buffet in the hotel...nasty.
reviews.title: 10 things you need to know...

reviews.text: The stratosphere was an okay experience. As first time Vegas goers we didn't know the best location to stay in. My husband was there for a convention and we chose the stratosphere, because it was close on the convention center on the map. It was still a long walk and too far from any action on the strip. He mostly road the convention shuttle anyways, I used the monorail to get around in the afternoons, however it was still a .25 mile walk from the nearest station. Next time we will pick a budget friendly hotel down the strip and in a slighty better neighborhood. There is so much contsruction between the stratosphere and the rest of the strip it is almost on the outskirts.
reviews.title: good and bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was ok, the facet dripped and the bathroom door didn't latch, but tolorable. I would skip the buffet in the hotel, just okay. Our buffet dinner we ate at the RIO and hilton was much better.
reviews.title: Crappy Rooms!

reviews.text: The cheapest place in the strip, very good room, but just regular comparing to the other hotels in vegas, but definetelly a place you would choose if you dont mind getting an ok room and if you are ok of getting cabs.
reviews.title: Cheap

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lugar barato e razoavel para o nivel vegas, mas se tiver de carro ou não ligar para andar de taxi, e se tanto faz o quarto do hotel, então é a melhor opção, principalmente na relação custo beneficio.
reviews.title: OK hotel, but not so good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was as good nice and clean. Big enough room, friendly staff, nice view from the Stratosphere tower. Just a pity that it's far away from everything (both The Strip as Fremont Street are a 30 minutes walk). You can take a bus though that stops right in front of the hotel.
reviews.title: a welcome return for us to the " Strato"

reviews.text: we certainly had a great stay once again, We go to plates buffet for our breakfast, as there is so much choice,especially fresh fruit, strawberries, fresh pineapple, melon, which is good for us. Room was cleaned thoroughly every day. Deuce bus is great for getting around the strip, and so cheap, better than paying out for a taxi. If you want to get to the airport(you can use your deuce tickets ) and get the 108 bus other side of the road to carl jnrs, quick fast and cheap.We noticed that the casino was kept clean with regular operatives emptying ashtrays, and generally disposing of rubbish. Real value for money, and although it is located the far end of the strip, it's lovely to get back to a peaceful room after being in the "hustle and bustle" and noise all day. Thank you to all the staff, Kati at Roxys, and Lorna at Plates.
reviews.title: Stay away!

reviews.text: Currently staying here, room is tiny, mold, ceiling by room door has water damage, moldy smell- kinda smells weird like they tried spraying to cover it up. Save yourself the trouble and stay at MGM. Our friends have rooms at MGM which are awesome, clean and newly furnished! Definitely will not be back! Staff are very helpful and friendly, but beware of ladies by the side entrance door as you arrive to check in, they will try to sell you things by saying they have a free gift for you. Did not experience this at any of the other hotels on the strip so not sure if this is typical or not. I was very disappointed by the fact we paid extra for a newly renovated premier tower room at the time of booking, premier was not what we got. We also requested a room with a view, the view we got was of the huge industrial fans and the roof of the parking garage. These fans kick on every half hour so which meant me being a light sleeper got no sleep, after the first night with the smell and the noise level - you can literally hear the conversations of people walking by the hallway at all hours and everything going on in the rooms next door, we refused to spend more than 2 or 3 hours trying to rest in our hotel room the remainder of our stay. Also bought some water for our room on the first morning and upon opening the grudge discovered that we had been left with a complimentary cupcake from Jean-Paul's or Jean-Pierre's bakery and a half eaten steak from the Top of the World restaurant in the tower and also some leftover Chinese food! Not sure how long these items were in the fridge and thought the stench in the room came from this, however, after throwing these items out the stench remained. The only good thing about the hotel is Roxy's Diner, had the biggest and best early morning grilled Cheese, also the buffet is $8.95 a person which is way cheaper than the other hotels on the strip. Definitely would not return, the room was so gross I was afraid to even take my shoes off never mind sit in the dirtiest sofa ever seen which was our sitting room!
reviews.title: Have to walk through sketchy area to catch monorail to the Strip.

reviews.text: I just went to Vegas for my first time this past weekend and it was pretty good and cheap! Yes the Stratosphere is at the end of the strip, SO WHAT?! THERE ARE 24 HOUR cabs out by the front to take you anywhere down the street to the strip. Face it the only thing you have your room for is to sleep and get ready. The hotel was affordable, very comfy & has its own little attractions. Everyone was very friendly and accomidating. The hotel has its shopping areas and food places for you grab a quick bite to eat with out going far. Over all I LOVED IT AND IM COMING BACK IN MARCH :)
reviews.title: TOTALY COMFY & WORTH IT

reviews.text: Our first time been Vegas back in September 2012 for a family trip. We stay this hotel for 3 nights. The location is at the end of the strip, not close to anywhere. It usually costs you $15 taxi go to center of strip such as Planet Hollywood or Paris Hotel. The room we stayed needs a major renovation: an old noise air con is right next to my bed, I had to turn it off when I sleep. An aged lamp pluged into a power point you can still see the naked wire. Housekeeper kept leaving a feedback survey in the room asking for more tips. We tried a newly openned buffet resturant, it was just ok, nothing special. The positive side is the the concierge staff were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: End of the strip stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very cheap for us about US$60 per night (+ "resort fee") and that's why we stayed there. The hotel is good, however rooms are rather tired. The Stratosphere is well out of the way of the main attractions of the rest of the strip, and walking outside is really like walking into a desert ...
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful - out of the way though

reviews.text: It is great to be able to go up to the top of the tower to finish your night though ...
reviews.title: Good hotel for the price

reviews.text: This was a nice hotel. I thought it offered a lot of good amenities, including a 24 hour diner.
reviews.title: Trip to the top of vegas

reviews.text: For the price we paid, it was an ok hotel. But some improvements needed. the phone did not work when i called another room and i cannot receive calls from another room as well.
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was clean, the shower was not strong enough, but my room smelled like a smoking room. Only booked for one night so didn't plan to ask for a new room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Dont think I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Quiet and clean

reviews.text: Lovely room all the staff were very helpful and polite Johnney Rocket's Diner was fantastic
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay In Vegas !!!

reviews.text: brilliant holiday
reviews.title: Nice room, but smoky casino and far away from the action
A Great View
reviews.text: On top of the stratosphere hotel is a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to watch the Disney Fireworks from. We
reviews.title: Great pool and newly renovated rooms

reviews.text: watched the hallowishes fireworks from here
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and we had a wonderful time on the rides and
reviews.title: Stratosphere - a little far from other casinos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: they were a BIG THRILL!!
reviews.title: Hotel with a 360 degree view of Las Vegas!
Much better than I expected!
reviews.text: I had a birthday party in a gorgeous room on the 104th floor of this hotel. This is a fabulous place to have an event. The view is unparalleled, food was exquisite, and the price per person was a LOT cheaper than other hotels on the Strip.

reviews.title: West Coast Tour 2007
reviews.text: I was worried about the hotel rooms, having seen reviews here, but I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Given the prices of hotel rooms on the strip, we were happy with the room prices here. Of course, you don't get bells and whistles in your rooms for the price, but some of my party said they were not much different from much bigger named hotels on the strip that they had stayed in.

reviews.title: Wonderful improvements
reviews.text: Having said that I have one BIG complaint. I was in one of their signature suites. The hotel does not have non-smoking suites!!! In this day and age, this is unacceptable to me. They put in some sort of "ozone" cleaner for an hour or so, but that had no apparent effect. I had to go out and buy a room deodorizer which helped a little. (There were no other available suites, and even if there were, I wasn't about to go door-to-door to see whether other rooms reeked as badly of stale smoke like my suite did).

reviews.title: Place is OK but over priced in gift shops
reviews.text: This is NOT a problem with regular rooms, just the suites.

reviews.title: Christmas Day 2005
reviews.text: This was my second stay at the "Strat", lets fancy it in Vegas a clean room and comfy bed are all need as there is so much to do and the "Strat" has plenty of these.

Spent a week here and thoroughly enjoyed a quieter part of the strip which suited me , 24 hour deuce buses right outside the hotel ,the restaurant at the top of the tower was out of this world the food was the best I've ever had first class
reviews.title: Would stay here again

reviews.text: The location is 20mins from the action on the strip which would be terrible in summer time. Casino is very friendly for $5 blackjack. Food is poor on site. New rooms are fine. Overall great deal if other hotels are over priced due to convention
reviews.title: Great price and good rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was clean and gambling was good. Even though it was at the other end of the strip it was fun and they are very accomodating. Enjoyed the view from the top of the hotel and their food was terrific. My husband and I loved this trip a lot of walking but worth it.
reviews.title: Great Times

reviews.text: This hotel is a little away from the strip , but has lots to offer, there is a casino dowstairs & a bar. If you want more alcohol for less cash , circle k is just next to it.The pool was just ok, I seen better ones, but the rides at the too of the tower are a thrill.
reviews.title: Very good prices,for lots of fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my first trip to Vegas and after reading all the negative reviews I had a little anxiety about staying here....but over all we really enjoyed our 5 night stay this past weekend. Yes it is at the very north end of the strip and not close to much but there is a bus stop right outside the hotel that runs 24/7 and taxis right outside the front door at all times. I bought a 3 day bus pass for $20 and rode the bus everywhere...even to the airport when I left. I liked the fact that I was able to get away from all the craziness when I went to sleep. This hotel is older and the room I stayed in was basic and not renovated but it was very clean, lots of room, basic flat screen tv and a comfy king size bed. Seriously for the price what more can you ask for? The casino is old but just an ordinary casino with slots and tables. The restaurants are good, theres a McDonalds on the R floor and a Starbucks on the main floor. The view from the tower is amazing whether day or night and you get to go up as many times as you want when you stay there. Not to mention the rides on top of the tower are out of this world. I also appreciated the customer service from the staff. Love the fact the bus stop was literally right outside, Circle K is next door for alcohol and munchies and theres an Ihop to the right and a Dennys to the left.
reviews.title: Enjoyed it!!!!!

reviews.text: I love the staying at this hotel. The staff is very friendly and always helpful. This hotel is most fun with the thrill rides at the top, from our room you could see the sky jumpers it was awesome. The bars are great the C bar was hoppin playing the best music and the Air Bar was spectacular with the best views and a great DJ our group had a blast at both bars. The buffet was great also but the place I like to eat the most was Roxy's diner, the staff is great and the food is wonderful very fun atmosphere. We also went to see BITE which was very interesting and thrilling it is a great show. The room was very clean the beds were comfortable extra pillows in the closet.. :) great! This is the hotel I will stay at when I go to Vegas!!
reviews.title: love this hotel

reviews.text: The Stratosphere marks the end of the North end of the strip. The surrounding neighborhood has suffered from casino closings, lots of empty buildings. The hotel is nice, modern and clean. The hundred story tower is the big draw. My major issue with the hotel is the stench of smoke. I could not figure out if the vent system is bad or there is just a lot of smokers. The updated rooms are nice, place is clean. Buffet was good, food was hot. I will warn you of the "resort" fee of $15 per night. I had business to conduct and was shocked to find a wireless fee of $11 per day !!! There is a Starbucks down the street with free WiFi. If you self park look for a long walk with your luggage.
reviews.title: An "Ok" Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can really see nothing that stands out with this property....it is just average. I am worried the surrounding neighborhoods will get worse as time goes on. The Sahara just closed and I can see the businesses suffering. You better have a car or rent one....this hotel is not near anything.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Excellent Service As Usual :)

reviews.text: There a lots of properties in Vegas with better resorts, better food and better locations, unless you get a great deal or comps I would stay somewhere else.
reviews.title: All wasn't lost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm happy to say some things never change - Like the service we get each time we stay at the Strat!! I have stayed at this hotel quite a few times and they have the friendliest staff! From the front desk to the girls that serve the drinks. Always smiling and I have never had to wait more than a few minutes for service. We were given the 1 bedroom star suite and that was beautiful. Our room was facing the strip and we could watch the bungie jumpers - the looks on their faces are priceless!!!
reviews.title: Good Price--Far from Main Strip

reviews.text: We were excited to stay here, we were traveling up to WA by truck, saving money was a must and well with this hotel we did. It was loud in the hall ways, but the rooms were descent, outdated upholstery, beds were comfortable had a great night view. Its at the end of the strip, far from most of its famous destinations...take your walking shoes if you plan on walking the strip.
reviews.title: "egh "

reviews.text: This hotel was ok it was good value when we booked it from the UK for a fortnight.
reviews.title: Hotel was ok - until we were robbed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location isn't the greatest but it was a clean base for our break.
reviews.title: Try somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The major downfall was though that about 4 days into our trip we were getting ready for a show when we discovered make up, perfume, expensive toiletries were missing in the room. We went straight down to reception to complain receptionist was not very helpful and seemed annoyed we were speaking about it in front of other desks, we were sent to security - the security manager came up to our room and said he would investigate and we asked to move to another room which he arranged for us. We contacted security a few days later and they said they had checked the door records and apart from the maids and ourselves no one else had entered the room and that was the end of the matter. Obviously the maid helped themselves to our staff and the stratosphere couldn't care less.
reviews.title: It was good for the value....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked here for two nights - regretted it. Booked a deluxe room - it was very basic. Long walks to your room whilst people smoke in corridors. Noisy and generally a tacky feel about the place. The casino is dated and so are a lot of the staff. The only good thing was that you can go up to the stratosphere viewing deck as many times as you like. There are plenty of better options!
reviews.title: great view
good value for teh money
reviews.text: With a price tag of $39 per day, plus some extras i think it was a grate deal, it is located a little far from the central action, but with a car its ok!

reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Price!
reviews.text: In the night te serrounding area is not the best i have seen and it make you feel unsafe.

reviews.title: A good hotel and value
reviews.text: The hotel is a little old, and the rooms are normal ( looks like the tipical super 8 motel but with a greate view to the strip or the desert ).

reviews.title: Good Hotel for the Price in Vegas
reviews.text: The casino and the buffet are OK not the best in Vegas but not te worst ... just like everithing in this hotel .. is an average class

reviews.title: Casino Good. Poker room small. Lower rooms suck.
reviews.text: We just got back from our stay at the Stratosphere over Veteran's Day weekend. I took my husband on a surprise trip to Vegas for his birthday and two of our friends came along. We have all been to Vegas several times and stayed on the other end of the strip most of those vacations. We were just looking for an affordable place to stay and weren't too concerned with the location. We found a great deal through Southwest airlines. We didn't go in with any high expectations and we were really pleased considering how little we paid.
I think other reviewers before me are pretty accurate. I got there and upgraded to a "Select" room for only $10 more a night. They were a very good value for the money.
reviews.title: Not bad, but may not be for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice rooms and generally priced far less than a comparable one
reviews.title: nice place for a get a way.

reviews.text: The rides and shops are decent for a day
reviews.title: My big short 2 day trip
Great Stay
reviews.text: Complete with restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed at here and was surprised. I did book a Casino Suite on-line for 119/night. The suite was large, had a sitting area, a bed in a seperate area, and a very large bathroom. There is a spa tub that seats 2 easly that has doors that open up to the living room. Also there is dual sinks and shower. The entry way and bathroom are marble. There are two TVs but neither are flat screen, but they worked just fine.
reviews.title: Good Stay

reviews.text: The view was not so good, but didn't have the room for the view. The way the room is set up, you enter through a long hallway, then have the living/bed area -- so you don't really hear the noise from teh hallway. The bed itself isn't the best, but it was triple sheated.
reviews.title: Loved It, Gambling Was Great, Rooms Were Nice.

likes.liked: — Clean nice rooms at a very affordable price.
likes.disliked: — Air conditioning really not working well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has a walk in closet.
reviews.title: Loved the views from the top!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only ordered room service and it was not badly priced, overall a short wait and not that bad. Nothing to say "wow" about.
reviews.title: Far, Far, Away.....
An employee Had "fun" with credit card!
reviews.text: Prices were burgers for $13, Steaks $25, breakfast $10-$15.

reviews.title: GREAT value!!! Loose slots too.
reviews.text: The Statosphere is at the far end of the strip so it's kind of a hike to get to ther middle of the strip where all the action is. We walked the entire length of the strip no problem and there's also the monorail for those who don't feel like walking in the heat. The hotel is also a short bus ride away from the Fremont Street experience.

reviews.title: hit or miss (this time miss)
reviews.text: Even though the Stratosphere is far down the strip, it is a great value. We stayed here for half the price of some of the middle-strip hotels. The room was very basic... one king bed with a view of the adjacent garage. However, the housekeeping was great. Our bathroom was sparkling clean everyday and our linens were changed daily. I wouldn't have paid for an upgrade because really, when you're in Vegas you don't spend much time in your room!!!

reviews.title: Good value for the price, IF you choose the right room
reviews.text: The pool area was very clean and spacious. The pool was never crowded and there were plenty of lounge chairs and towels.

reviews.title: Running away from home
reviews.text: The casino was awesome! I found the slots to be very loose and it was not as crowded as other Vegas casinos. The waitresses came around often with complimentary drinks too.

reviews.title: Absolutely Horrible
reviews.text: The restaurants were okay. I really liked Lucky's and found it to be a great deal. I was also happy that there was a McDonalds in the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel tower was recently redone. The rooms are nicely decorated as is the hallway. The nice surprise for the price was the pool area on the roof. It was quite and large and relaxing, There is a bar server up there too. Also we received a free trip up to the top which was fun.
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Nice Rooftop Pool Area
Great for the price
reviews.text: As far as the casino, no big winning and the service was very slow.

This hotel is at the very end of the strip so I wouldn't suggest walking to get to the action or you'll never make it. Everything looks closer on the map than when you're walking. In a few more years they may have more built up around them but for now, there isn't much around. The bus is easy and stops right there. The location was the biggest downfall, but the hotel was also the closest to downtown. Because it was a bit further away it was quiet. Also, if you want to print off your boarding pass, you'll have to pay the concierge to do it.
reviews.title: Nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it's a great value for the price.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the view & the price

reviews.text: This was our second time staying at the stratosphere. It has been remodeled since our first stay, and looked great. We paid an excellent price for our rooms, so the resort fee we were charged when checking in wasn't terrible. It's also great that when staying there you can go up to the tower for free. Take that into account when being annoyed w the resort fee. Still way cheaper than paying a ticket up to the top one time. And your room key gets four people up.
reviews.title: Great first experience in Las Vegas!
Good hotel in a quieter area of "the strip"
reviews.text: We stopped at the Stratosphere for a 3 night stay, at the start of our Las Vegas to San Francisco road trip.

Overall the hotel offers everything that is needed, the rooms are of a decent size and are very clean. However the rooms do not have tea or coffee making facilities. There is a 24hour coffee shop downstairs in the casino, but I brought my own kettle with me. There is also no free WIFI, internet access is charged extra to the room.
reviews.title: Another Pleasant surprise for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located right at the bottom of the famous Las Vegas strip, which means it is very quiet and allows you to take a break from the whole madness that is Las Vegas. However that also means it is a LONG walk to the nearest hotel, which is Circus Circus, now the Sahara has closed.
reviews.title: Out of the way

reviews.text: There is a stop for the Deuce bus right outside the hotel, which will take you right down to the main area of the strip or down to Freemont street area. The buses are regular and are value for money.
reviews.title: Budget hotel

reviews.text: On my last trip to LV I used to travel to this area of the strip via the monorail, but sadly the closest station is at the Sahara, which is now closed, which means the Deuce is now the only way to travel to the better end of the strip.
reviews.title: Excellent experience!!

aka: Stratosphere Hotel, Casino And Tower Hotel Las Vegas
